VLIB Function Reference

Color Space Conversions

Introduction and Use Cases

Different vision algorithms are created or optimized to work on different color spaces or formats of the video. If the input image format does is not in a format that an algorithm requires, it may be necessary to make a color space conversion. VLIB offers following kernels for different color space conversions.
  1. Extract luma function extracts only luma component from either YUYV or UYUV formats.
  2. Insert luma function inserts only luma component into YUYV format.
  3. UYVY interleaved format to either YUV422pl, YUV420pl, or YUV444pl.
  4. UYVY interleaved format to either HSL, LAB, or RGB planar.
  5. UYVY semiplanar to YUV planar.
  6. YUV422 planar to UYVY interleaved.
  7. NV12 to RGB planar.

For more details about individual APIs refer the function below.

Specification

APIS

  • VLIB_extractLumaFromUYUV
  • VLIB_extractLumaFromYUYV
  • VLIB_insertLumaIntoYUYV
  • VLIB_convertUYVYint_to_YUV422pl
  • VLIB_convertUYVYint_to_YUV420pl
  • VLIB_convertUYVYint_to_YUV444pl
  • VLIB_convertUYVYint_to_HSLpl
  • VLIB_convertUYVYint_to_LABpl
  • VLIB_convertUYVYint_to_RGBpl
  • VLIB_initUYVYint_to_LABpl_LUT
  • VLIB_convertUYVYint_to_LABpl_LUT
  • VLIB_convertUYVYsemipl_to_YUVpl
  • VLIB_convertUYVYpl_to_YUVint
  • VLIB_convert_NV12_to_RGBpl_tile
